meanings.definition: Greater in number, quantity, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The preponderant amount of apples in the basket made it difficult to carry.
meanings.sent2: Her preponderant knowledge of the subject impressed the entire class.
meanings.sent3: The preponderant number of balloons in the room made it look like a colorful cloud.
meanings.sent4: His preponderant influence over the team led them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The preponderant mountain stood tall among the hills, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: Having superior weight, force, or influence.
meanings.sent1: The preponderant force of the waterfall created a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent2: The preponderant argument in the debate swayed the audience's opinion.
meanings.sent3: The preponderant weight of the elephant caused the bridge to creak.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderant presence in the room made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent5: The preponderant storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky, ready to burst.

meanings.sent1: The preponderant role of the captain was evident in every decision made.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the preponderant character's actions drove the plot forward.
meanings.sent3: The preponderant color in the painting seemed to jump out at the viewer.
meanings.sent4: His preponderant ideas shaped the direction of the project.
meanings.sent5: The preponderant star in the sky shone brighter than all the others combined.
